qas.question: What causes flooding, property damage, and loss of life?

answers.text: a piece of glacier will detach or break

qas.question: What killed about 2500 people in the 17th century?
How many homes in a village near Zermatt were destroyed by an avalanche in the 19th century?

context: Glaciers end in ice caves (the Rhone Glacier), by trailing into a lake or river, or by shedding snowmelt on a meadow. Sometimes <a0_0>a piece of glacier will detach or break<a0_0/> resulting in flooding, property damage and loss of life. In the 17th century about 2500 people were killed by <a1_0>an avalanche<a1_0/> in a village on the French-Italian border; in the 19th century <a2_0>120 homes<a2_0/> in a village near Zermatt were destroyed by an avalanche.
